question: A 16-year-old hirsute girl comes to the outpatient department with the complaint of a few bumps scattered symmetrically on her lower legs that developed 1 week after shaving. Initially, the lesions were tiny but now they are slightly raised, red papules. There is no associated pain, itching, or discharge. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of raised, well-defined, erythematous plaques in submammary areas. He has a previous history of similar lesions in the armpits and groin area. He has not taken any drugs recently. What is his probable diagnosis?

A 25-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of raised, well-defined, erythematous plaques in submammary areas. He has a previous history of similar lesions in the armpits and groin area. He has not taken any drugs recently. What is his differential diagnosis?

A female patient presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of eczematous oozing lesions on both ears 2 days after attending a wedding. Differential diagnosis of atopic eczema is established. In what category do her symptoms fall into?
Which of the following drugs is a topical scabicide agent?
Which of the following is an adverse effect of flucytosine?
Which of the following diseases do not cause Steven Johnson syndrome?
Which of the following drugs is suitable for systemic treatment of scabies?

A 5-year-old boy presents with generalized itching all over the body. On examination, there are excoriated papules and pustules over the genitals, fingers, and interdigital areas. What is his most appropriate treatment?
A female presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of acne and excessive hair growth. On examination, she is obese. She has a history of menstrual abnormalities. What is her diagnosis?

A patient presents to the outpatient department with complaints of blisters on the skin and mucous membranes. On examination, blisters are acantholytic and Nikolsky's sign is positive. Which of the following is used as a confirmatory test?

answers.option: Skin immunofluorescence with anti-IgG and IgA antibodies

question: "Raindrops in the dust" pigmentation and hyperkeratosis are characteristic findings of which poison?

A middle-aged farmer came to the clinic with a mass in the inner canthus of his eye. This mass was surgically removed and histologically diagnosed as basal cell carcinoma (BCC). Which of the following characteristics indicates a high-risk BCC?

answers.option: Tumor with no recurrence before but now has recurrence
The tumor present on the trunk

question: Sports medicine is a branch of medicine that deals with physical fitness, treatment, and prevention of injuries related to sports and exercise. Specific treatment programs for sportspersons are important, considering the scope of nutrition for sportspeople. To cover the optimal nutritional requirements, the caloric intake should be according to which of the following?

In sports medicine, what is the type of physical training that is designed to improve specific motor abilities such as strength, endurance, speed, agility, and flexibility tailored to enhance overall performance and fitness levels?

Which of the following is known as the general capacity to adapt and respond favorably to physical effort, depending on the individual's state of health, body constitution, and present and previous physical activity?
A patient presents with pigmentation under the nail and palpable axillary lymph nodes. Excision biopsy is indicated. What will be the differential diagnosis based on the clinical presentation?

An elderly patient living near the equator, a farmer by profession had a previous burn over his trunk 15 years ago. Now for 1 month, this burn scar has turned into a raised lesion along with ulceration, itching, and some mild discharge. On histopathology, it was diagnosed as Marjolin's ulcer. What is the best option regarding excisional margin?

answers.option: Both <2cm lesion needed clearance of 2 mm margin and >2 cm lesion needed clearance of 1 cm margin are correct
>2 cm lesion needed clearance of 1 cm margin
>2 cm lesion needed clearance of 1 mm margin
<2 cm lesion needed clearance of 2 mm margin
Squamous cell carcinoma can be dealt with radiotherapy until patient has recurrence

question: Sea diving is a high-risk activity with a death rate of 0.4 per 1000 participants. More than 25% of deaths occur in young male divers. Loss of consciousness accounts for the greatest number of deaths and is usually attributed to which of the following?

A 30-year-old man, who works at a restaurant, is brought by his coworkers to the hospital with burn injuries on both legs after getting in contact with boiling water. The affected area is blistered with clear fluid and the area is painful. According to the classification for burns, which degree burn is this?
Which of the following is an indication that a recovering patient with a burn injury after treatment is out of danger and at a low risk of infection?

An effective burn prevention plan should be multi-sectoral and include broad efforts to improve awareness and develop and enforce effective policy. For this purpose, what is the first and most important step?

answers.option: Describe burden and identify risk factors
Set research priorities with promotion of promising interventions
Improve burn care facilities in hospitals

question: A man visited a primary healthcare center with complaints of pimple-like rash between fingers, on wrist, elbows, armpits, and navel. He complained of intense itching, especially at night. There were sores on the body caused by scratching. Which one of the following is the most appropriate treatment for this patient's condition?

Louse-borne relapsing fever epidemic appears from time to time in districts of Pakistan adjoining Afghanistan, particularly when nomads migrate during winter. Louse does not transmit infection through bite or feces but the organism gains access through infected fluid liberated when the victim crushes the louse or scratches the area where the louse is feeding. Which one of the following is the most appropriate prevention for this infection?

An 8-year-old male child presented with an itchy rash over the body for the last 2 weeks. On examination, there are multiple papules over the finger webs and genitals, excoriation marks were also present over the limbs and trunks and a few linear raised lesions were present between the toes. On further details, his mother said her other child was also complaining of itch and their sleep is disturbed due to itching. What is the characteristic lesion of this condition?

An elderly homeless male has had a rash all over his body for two months. On examination, crusted, hyperkeratotic lesions were present mainly over the palms and soles. There is scaling and erythema all over the body, and the nails are also thickened and rough. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 10-year-old boy presented with severe itching over the scalp for the last month. Itching was throughout the day. It was not associated with any change in shampoos. On examination, there are multiple small whitish structures seen over the occipital area, and the hair shaft is more pronounced on the occipital and parietal areas. What is the likely diagnosis?

A five-year-old boy presented with a few circular patches of hair loss over the scalp covered with fine grey scales for the last 2 months. It was associated with mild itching. Wood's lamp examination showed green fluorescent. There was no history of fever or lymphadenopathy. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 2-year-old baby presented with itching all over the body for a few months. On examination, she had generalized dry skin and there were erythematous plaques of excoriation, hyperkeratosis over the cheeks, cubital fossa, and popliteal fossa. There is a positive history of asthma and allergic rhinitis in the family. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 20-year-old male presented with itching over the scalp and dryness of the face for the last 6 weeks. He has similar episodes, especially in winter. On examination of the scalp and face, there were greasy yellowish scales, and the back of the ear, nasolabial fold, and eyebrows had erythematous patches with fine scales. What is the likely diagnosis?
All of the following are the advantages of silicone implants except:
Which of the following is not an example of a local flap?

An 87-year-old man presents with erythema and blistering of his chest and upper extremities. Examination shows tense bullae on an erythematous base. A skin biopsy reveals subepidermal blisters with inflammatory infiltrate with numerous eosinophils. Which of the following is true for the direct immunofluorescence findings regarding the diagnosis?

answers.option: Deposition of IgA at the dermo-epidermal junction
Deposition of IgG and C3 in a linear fashion along the dermal basement membrane
Deposition of IgG and C3 in a fishnet pattern
Deposition of IgG and C1q around the hair follicles
Deposition of IgM and fibrin around dermal blood vessels

question: Which of the following best corresponds to the histopathological features of pemphigus vulgaris?

answers.option: Focal acantholysis with a various pattern and negative direct immunofluorescence
Acantholytic dyskeratotic cells and parakeratotic columns with negative direct immunofluorescence
Intraepidermal acantholysis with chicken wire pattern IgG on direct immunofluorescence
Dilapidated brick wall appearance with negative direct immunofluorescence

question: A 20-year-old resident from Gadap Town Karachi visited a hospital for complaints of weight loss, irritation, and white bands on fingernails. He is a farmer who used to drink well water. There is no history of addiction. Chronic poisoning from which of the following is most likely to be present in this patient?

In developing countries morbidity and mortality due to accidents are rising. According to the observations made by the Karachi Development Authority, which of the following is the most affected in city accidents?
The first instrument built specifically for skin graft harvesting was developed by?
In which of the following are transposition flaps very useful?

A young medical student has developed foul-smelling breath for the last few weeks. He noticed a bluish line on the gums of the upper jaw and a loss of appetite. Red marks on the back are also present. Poisoning from which of the following is most likely in this patient?

A 37-year-old man complained of anorexia, nausea, enlargement of his breast, and fatigue. The man, recently diagnosed with pulmonary coccidioidomycosis, has been receiving an antifungal treatment for two weeks. Which of the following drugs most likely caused these adverse effects?
Ivermectin is indicated in the treatment of which of the following skin infections?
A building collapsed even before the completion of the project, many workers were severely injured. What are the efforts aimed at treating and rehabilitating the victims referred as?

A patient comes to the dermatology outpatient department (OPD) with a complaint of progressively increasing pigmentation under his nail. On examination, he also has a palpable cervical lymph node. What is the most possible diagnosis for this patient?
A graft is applied to an approximately >10 cm burn wound area. Which of the following grafts has more primary contraction?
A 20-year-old boy applies a skin graft over a wound, which heals in four phases. Which of the following is NOT one of these phases?
Why is there a need for a mesh graft in a 15% burn patient?

answers.option: Uniform distribution of the graft as a source of spread epidermis
Increases the area of the graft

question: An 82-year-old man presented with a 1.2 x 0.7 cm nodular dichromic lesion on the scalp. The patient’s personal medical history was unremarkable. Which positive immune stain would confirm the diagnosis of invasive melanoma?

A sudden explosion happens in a busy marketplace, after which rescue workers start assessing the injured and tagging them with different color codes. Which of the following term best describes this action?

A 36-year-old man presents with swollen, painful heels, nail changes, and left lower back pain that wakes him up from sleep. The back pain gets better with exercise. He reports 1 to 2 hours of morning stiffness. He also has a history of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis since he was 12 years old. It is decided to change his current regimen of indomethacin to a biologic that is a cluster of differentiation-2 (CD-2) receptor antagonist used in the treatment of psoriasis. Which of the following drugs is prescribed to him?

A 65-year-old male presents to the hospital with shortness of breath and cardiac illness. Which of the following antifungal agents should be avoided in patients with evidence of ventricular dysfunction?
The four principal components in managing humanitarian supplies are acquisition, transportation, storage, and distribution. These happen during which phase of disaster management?

A 55-year-old obese female, with a known case of diabetes mellitus, presented with an itchy rash over the chest and lower abdomen for 2 weeks. On examination, ill-defined erythematous beefy patches with multiple small satellite lesions over the sub-mammary area, lower abdomen, and inguinal region. What is the likely diagnosis?
Wickham’s striae refer to:

answers.option: White spots on buccal mucosa opposite to the 2nd premolar tooth
Stretch marks due to topical potent steroids
Thin white line in lichen planus

question: A young female presented with an extremely itchy rash over her limbs for the past 20 days. On examination, purplish papules with flat tops were present over the volar aspect of the wrist and extensor surfaces of arms and legs. Few papules were also erythematous. There was no scaling. Itching was present throughout the day with a negative family history. What is the diagnosis?

A young patient presented to dermatology OPD with multiple small white spots on the upper body with slight scaling. It was associated with mild itching. He was diagnosed as a case of tinea versicolor. He was prescribed oral antifungals. What is the primary lesion in this scenario?

A 48-year-old female presented with thickened, discolored nails associated with pain for the last 2 months. On examination, there were onycholysis, subungual hyperkeratosis, and ridging in five nails of both hands associated with paronychia. What is the likely diagnosis?

A school-going girl presented with severe itching over the scalp for several days. On examination, she has few papules, pustules, and excoriation on the scalp along with cervical lymphadenopathy. Hair shows nits (empty eggs) of insects. What is the likely diagnosis?

A patient came to the outpatient department with pigmentation on the face for three months. On close examination, she has hyperpigmented patches on the face with hypopigmented margins. What is the diagnosis?

A 30-year-old nursing staff member presented to the dermatology outpatient department with a complaint of a rash on both hands for the past 3 to 4 months. On examination, the hands were dry, cracked, and hyperkeratotic with an erythematous background, involving the dorsal and palmar surface of the hands extending up to the wrist. The patient also noticed some improvement when she was on vacation. What is the first-line management in this patient?
